alert.note: Alert for Eastern Currituck (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Beach Hazards Statement issued September 12 at 8:08PM EDT until September 13 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT IN EFFECT THROUGH TUESDAY EVENING... * WHAT...A high risk of rip currents and rough nearshore surf. * WHERE...Beaches of the Northern Outer Banks * WHEN...Through Tuesday evening. * IMPACTS...Breaking waves of 4 to 5 feet and onshore long period swell will result in rough surf conditions and a high risk of rip currents. Time of high total tides are approximate to the nearest hour. COROLLA NC MLLW CATEGORIES - MINOR 5.5 FT, MODERATE 6.0 FT, MAJOR 6.5 FT MHHW CATEGORIES - MINOR 1.8 FT, MODERATE 2.3 FT, MAJOR 2.8 FT TOTAL TOTAL DEPARTURE DAY/TIME TIDE TIDE FROM NORM WAVES FLOOD FT MLLW FT MHHW FT FT IMPACT -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 12/10 PM 4.6 0.9 0.8 4-5 NONE 13/10 AM 5.0 1.3 0.8 3-4 NONE 13/10 PM 4.2 0.5 0.7 3 NONE 14/11 AM 5.0 1.3 0.9 3 NONE 14/11 PM 3.8 0.1 0.5 2-3 NONE 15/12 PM 4.4 0.7 0.5 2-3 NONE &&
info.instruction: Remain out of the water to avoid hazardous swimming conditions.
